On this page:

Our deep learning example

Author

Marie-Hélène Burle

The problem

A fine-grained classification task where distinguishing features are subtle.

The data

NABirds dataset from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology

48,562 images of 404 bird species Many of these species are further subdivided into categories such as Male/Female, Adult/Juvenile, Breeding/Non-breeding, which leads to 555 total classes

UUID

The data is roughly evenly split between training and validation (23,929 training and 24,633 validation). The number of training images per class is quite variable, with 60 images for about a quarter of classes, and single digits for some of the rarer varieties (4 for the white winged dark-eyed junco and 5 for the female harlequin duck.)

Our strategy
